newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM June copper output up 5,821 tonnes.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM June copper output up 5,821 tonnes.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) copper production rose by 5,821 tonnes in June, a company spokesman said on Tuesday.
The spokesman said production rose to 31,263 tonns from 25,442 tonnes in May and 21,380 tonnes in April.

"ZCCM's production of copper for the 1997/98 financial year continues to improve with total finished copper for the month of June going up to 31,263 tonnes, beating the official target of 29,571 tonnes," the spokesman said.

"The good performance is attributable to improved production at all the mines and improved performance at all the smelters. Only Nkana smelter and the Chambishi RLE plant (recorded) small deficits," it said.
However, cobalt production remained below target in June at 311 tonnes of finished cobalt, against a targetted 364 tonnes.
"The June production figure was, however, higher than the May figure of 301 tonnes," the spokesman said.
